description: stall +‎ -age? Compare Old French estallange, of German origin.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) The erection and use of a stall at a fair or market.
(obsolete) The dues levied for the erection and use of a stall at a fair or market.
examples: Stallage and the like payments are made in respect of some user of the soil beyond the mere entry into the market; for no one has a right to erect a stall or appropriate part of the market place as a standing without making a satisfaction for it to the owner of the soil  […]

entries.meaning: (obsolete) dung of cattle or horses, mixed with straw
